topic: How to deploy ETL jobs using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to deploy ETL jobs using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deploying ETL Jobs Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to create and deploy ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) jobs using FastAPI in Python 3.12+. The example provided showcases an ETL pipeline for a simple dataset and demonstrates the benefits of integrating FastAPI into your data processing workflow.
key_points: FastAPI provides a modern, high-performance web framework to build efficient APIs in Python.
This guide uses Python 3.12+, which includes new features and improvements that enhance the efficiency of the FastAPI application.
ETL jobs can be exposed as APIs using FastAPI, making them easily accessible and scalable.
The example provided processes a CSV file containing a simple dataset and stores the results in SQLite.
FastAPI makes it easy to integrate with other data processing libraries like pandas, sqlalchemy, and psycopg2 for more complex ETL jobs.

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI
app = FastAPI()
# ... ETL pipeline implementation goes here ...
CREATE TABLE my_table (id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, value TEXT);

version_notes: Python 3.12+ features used in this example include: async context managers, assignment expressions, and walrus operator.
caveats: This example is a simplified demonstration of deploying ETL jobs using FastAPI. For real-world applications, consider integrating with an orchestration tool like Airflow for scheduling and monitoring.
Make sure to handle errors and edge cases in your production ETL pipeline.
